DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Systemic Therapy Surgery Sequence Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records the sequencing of systemic therapy (RX Summ-Chemo [1390], RX Summ-Hormone [1400], RX Summ-BRM [1410], and RX Summ-Transplnt/Endocr [3250]) and surgical procedures given as part of the first course of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Systemic Therapy Surgery Sequence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The sequencing of systemic therapy (RX Summ-Chemo [1390], RX Summ-Hormone [1400], RX Summ-BRM [1410], and RX Summ-Transplnt/Endocr [3250]) and surgical procedures given as part of the first course of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: (sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

Concepts.definition: Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Systemic Therapy Surgery Sequence Number Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: (sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intraoperative systemic therapy with other therapy administered before or after surgery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intraoperative systemic therapy with other therapy administered before or after surgery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intraoperative systemic therapy with other therapy administered before or after surgery

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Systemic therapy both before and after surgery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Systemic therapy both before and after surgery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Systemic therapy both before and after surgery

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No systemic therapy and/or surgical procedures; unknown if surgery and/or systemic therapy given

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No systemic therapy and/or surgical procedures; unknown if surgery and/or systemic therapy given
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No systemic therapy and/or surgical procedures; unknown if surgery and/or systemic therapy given

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sequence unknown, but both surgery and systemic therapy given

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sequence unknown, but both surgery and systemic therapy given
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sequence unknown, but both surgery and systemic therapy given

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Systemic Therapy Surgery Sequence Number Code
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: (sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
